title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4005.5 - Veterinarians restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4005.5 - Veterinarians restricted

State Regulations
(a) No
veterinarian or veterinary technician employed by the commission or by an
association shall be permitted, during the period of his or her employment, to
treat or prescribe for any horse for compensation or otherwise, except in case
of emergency or race-day medication permitted by section
4043.2
of this Article. (b) The functions of a veterinary technician
shall be performed only at the direction and under the supervision of a
licensed veterinarian who is on the same premises, except a veterinary
technician who is employed by the commission or an association and is
collecting biologic samples for regulatory testing may do so under the general
supervision of a licensed veterinarian. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4005.5

Amended

New

York State Register February 10, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 06, eff. 2/10/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
